case_name: Mahant of the Asthal Estate, Salauna v. Board of Agricultural Income-tax, Bihar

facts.text: Civil Appeal No.449 of 1958 is an appeal by special leave.

anchor.surface_text: Civil Appeal No.449 of 1958. Appeal by special leave from the judgment and decree dated August 7, 1956, of the Patna High Court in Misc. Judicial Case No. 604 of 1953.

facts.text: Patna High Court delivered judgment and decree dated August 7, 1956 in Misc. Judicial Case No. 604 of 1953.

anchor.surface_text: Appeal by special leave from the judgment and decree dated August 7, 1956, of the Patna High Court in Misc. Judicial Case No. 604 of 1953.

facts.text: Patna High Court answered affirmatively the question referred by the Board of Agricultural Income-tax under s. 28(3) of the Bihar Agricultural Income-tax Act.

anchor.surface_text: The High Court of Judicature at Patna answered in the affirmative the following question which was submitted by the Board of Agricultural Income-tax, Bihar, under s. 28 3  of the Bihar Agricultural Income-tax Act, XXXII of 1948-hereinafter referred to as the Act

facts.text: The question was whether the petitioner could be legally assessed for the income of the Estate in 1355 Fasli when the Estate was in the hand of the Receiver.

anchor.surface_text: Whether, in the facts and circumstances of the case, the petitioner companyld be legally assessed for the income of the Estate in 1355 Fasli when the Estate was in the hand of the Receiver ?

facts.text: Appeal preferred with special leave under Art. 136 of the Constitution against the order of the High Court.

anchor.surface_text: With special leave under Art. 136 of the Constitution, this appeal is preferred against the order of the High Court.

facts.text: Appellant is the Mahant of the Asthal Estate, Salauna, in the District of Bhagalpur in Bihar.

anchor.surface_text: The appellant is the Mahant of the Asthal Estate, Salauna, in the District of Bhagalpur in Bihar.

facts.text: A Court Receiver was appointed by the First Class Subordinate Judge, Monghyr, to manage the estate in a suit concerning that estate.

anchor.surface_text: In a suit companycerning that estate, a Court Receiver was appointed by the First Class Subordinate Judge, Monghyr, to manage the estate.

facts.text: The Receiver functioned till sometime in December, 1949.

anchor.surface_text: The Receiver functioned till sometime in December, 1949, and under the order of the Subordinate Judge he handed over charge of the estate to the appellant on January 8, 1950.

facts.text: Receiver handed over charge of the estate to the appellant on January 8, 1950 under order of the Subordinate Judge.

anchor.surface_text: The Receiver functioned till sometime in December, 1949, and under the order of the Subordinate Judge he handed over charge of the estate to the appellant on January 8, 1950.

facts.text: Appellant submitted a return of income of the estate to the Agricultural Income-tax Officer, Monghyr, on January 15, 1950 for the Fasli year 1355 corresponding to September 16, 1948 to September 15, 1949.

anchor.surface_text: On January 15, 1950, the appellant submitted a return of income of the estate to the Agricultural Income-tax Officer, Monghyr, for the Fasli year 1355 companyresponding to September 16, 1948, to September 15, 1949.

facts.text: Fasli year 1355 corresponds to September 16, 1948 to September 15, 1949.

anchor.surface_text: for the Fasli year 1355 companyresponding to September 16, 1948, to September 15, 1949.

facts.text: Agricultural Income-tax Officer assessed agricultural income of the estate at Rs. 90,507-2-6 and ordered appellant to pay Rs. 20,290-13-0 as tax on August 7, 1950.

anchor.surface_text: The Agricultural Income- tax Officer assessed on August 7, 1950, the agricultural income of the estate at Rs. 90,507-2-6 and ordered the appellant to pay Rs. 20,290-13-0 as agricultural income-tax.

facts.text: Appeals against the assessment order to the Commissioner of Agricultural Income-tax and the Board of Agricultural Income-tax, Bihar were unsuccessful.

anchor.surface_text: Appeals against the order of assessment preferred to the Commissioner of Agricultural Income-tax and the Board of Agricultural Income-tax, Bihar, were unsuccessful.

facts.text: Board of Agricultural Income-tax referred the question to the High Court under s. 28(3) of the Act.

anchor.surface_text: The Board however referred the question set out hereinbefore to the High Court under s. 28 3  of the Act as arising out of its order.

facts.text: The estate was in the management of the Court Receiver during the relevant year.

anchor.surface_text: the income of the Estate in 1355 Fasli when the Estate was in the hand of the Receiver ?

facts.text: Appellant contended that under s.13, only the Receiver is deemed assessee and liable for tax.

anchor.surface_text: The appellant urged that if the land from which agricultural income is derived is held by a Receiver and the income is received by the Receiver, the Receiver alone can, by virtue of s. 13, be deemed to be the assessee and the Receiver alone is liable to pay the tax in respect of that income.

facts.text: Income collected by Receiver was the income of the appellant.

anchor.surface_text: The income though companylected by the Receiver was the income of the appellant.

facts.text: Appellant urged that income received from Receiver did not retain character of agricultural income.

anchor.surface_text: Counsel for the appellant urged that the income received by the appellant from the Receiver did number retain its character of agricultural income and therefore also the appellant was number liable to pay agricultural income-tax.

facts.text: The contention about character of income was never raised before the taxing authorities.

anchor.surface_text: But this companytention was never raised before the taxing authorities and numbersuch question has been referred to this companyrt.

facts.text: Judgment delivered on January 11, 1961 by SHAH, J.

anchor.surface_text: 1961. January 11. The Judgment of the Court was delivered by SHAH, J.-

facts.text: Income of the estate was not exempt from payment of tax.

anchor.surface_text: The income of the estate of the appellant was number exempt from payment of tax and by virtue of s. 3, agricultural income-tax was charged upon the income for the assessment year in question,

issues.text: Whether, in the facts and circumstances of the case, the petitioner companyld be legally assessed for the income of the Estate in 1355 Fasli when the Estate was in the hand of the Receiver

anchor.surface_text: Whether, in the facts and circumstances of the case, the petitioner companyld be legally assessed for the income of the Estate in 1355 Fasli when the Estate was in the hand of the Receiver ?

issues.text: whether the appellant was liable to be assessed to pay agricultural income-tax for the year in which the estate was in the management of the Court Receiver

anchor.surface_text: The only question which falls to be determined in this appeal is whether the appellant was liable to be assessed to pay agricultural income-tax for the year in which the estate was in the management of the Court Receiver.

issues.text: whether the income received by the appellant from the Receiver did retain its character of agricultural income

anchor.surface_text: Counsel for the appellant urged that the income received by the appellant from the Receiver did number retain its character of agricultural income and therefore also the appellant was number liable to pay agricultural income-tax.

arguments.claim: If the land from which agricultural income is derived is held by a Receiver and the income is received by the Receiver, the Receiver alone can, by virtue of s. 13, be deemed to be the assessee and the Receiver alone is liable to pay the tax in respect of that income.

anchor.surface_text: The appellant urged that if the land from which agricultural income is derived is held by a Receiver and the income is received by the Receiver, the Receiver alone can, by virtue of s. 13, be deemed to be the assessee and the Receiver alone is liable to pay the tax

court_response_anchor.surface_text: herefrom, the aggregate of the sums payable as agricultural income-tax by each person on the agricultural income derived from such land and received b

arguments.court_reasoning: s. 13 deems the receiver an assessee in addition to the owner but is merely a machinery provision for recovery of tax, not a charging section; does not absolve the owner from liability; taxing authorities may assess either.

arguments.claim: The definition of 'person' in s. 2 cl. (m) supports that the receiver alone is the assessee liable for tax.

anchor.surface_text: In support of his contention, the appellant relies upon the definition of the word "person" in s. 2, cl. (m) which defines "person" to mean any individual or association of individuals, owning or holding property for himself or for any other, or partly for his own benefit and partly for another, either as owner, trustee, receiver, common manager, administrator or executor or in any capacity recognised by law, and includes an undivided Hindu family, firm or company.

court_response_anchor.surface_text: . The liability to pay tax is charged on the agricultural income of every person. The income though companylected by the Receiver was the income of th

arguments.court_reasoning: Inclusion of receiver in definition of person allows taxing authorities to assess such persons but does not exempt the owner's income from tax liability.

arguments.claim: The income received by the appellant from the Receiver did not retain its character of agricultural income and therefore the appellant was not liable to pay agricultural income-tax.

anchor.surface_text: Counsel for the appellant urged that the income received by the appellant from the Receiver did not retain its character of agricultural income and therefore also the appellant was not liable to pay agricultural income-tax.

court_response_anchor.surface_text: able to pay tax, does number absolve the appellant on whose behalf the income was received from the obligation to pay agricultural income-tax. Section

arguments.court_reasoning: This contention was never raised before the taxing authorities and no such question was referred to the court; character was accepted as agricultural income.

arguments.claim: By virtue of s. 3, agricultural income-tax is charged on the total agricultural income of the previous year of every person and the appellant is prima facie liable as owner.

anchor.surface_text: Section 3 of the Act which is the charging section provides : "Agricultural income-tax shall be charged for each financial year... on the total agricultural income of the previous year of every person." ... The income of the estate of the appellant was not exempt from payment of tax and by virtue of s. 3, agricultural income-tax was charged upon the income for the assessment year in question, and the appellant was prima facie liable as owner of the estate to pay tax on that income.

arguments.claim: The income though collected by the Receiver was the income of the appellant.

anchor.surface_text: The income though collected by the Receiver was the income of the appellant.

arguments.claim: By s. 13, in addition to the owner, the Receiver is to be deemed to be an assessee but this does not absolve the owner from liability.

anchor.surface_text: By s. 13, in addition to the owner, the Receiver is to be deemed to be an assessee. But the fact that the Receiver may... be deemed to be an assessee and liable to pay tax, does not absolve the appellant on whose behalf the income was received from the obligation to pay agricultural income-tax.

arguments.claim: Section 13 merely provides a machinery for recovery of tax, and is not a charging section.

anchor.surface_text: Section 13 merely provides a machinery for recovery of tax, and is not a charging section.

arguments.claim: The taxing authorities may but are not bound to assess the receiver; they may always proceed against the owner.

anchor.surface_text: When property is in the possession of the Receiver, common manager or administrator, the taxing authorities may, but are not bound to, treat such persons as assessees and recover tax. The taxing authorities may always proceed against the owner of the income and assess the tax against him.

arguments.claim: There is no substance in the contention raised by the appellant.

anchor.surface_text: In our view, there is no substance in the contention raised by the appellant.

holdings.text: The income of the estate of the appellant was not exempt from payment of tax and by virtue of s. 3, agricultural income-tax was charged upon the income for the assessment year in question, and the appellant was prima facie liable as owner of the estate to pay tax on that income.

anchor.surface_text: The income of the estate of the appellant was not exempt from payment of tax and by virtue of s. 3, agricultural income-tax was charged upon the income for the assessment year in question, and the appellant was prima facie liable as owner of the estate to pay tax on that income.

holdings.reasoning_summary: Applies charging provision in s.3 to total agricultural income of every person including owner, regardless of management.

holdings.text: In our view, there is no substance in the contention raised by the appellant.

anchor.surface_text: In our view, there is no substance in the contention raised by the appellant.

holdings.reasoning_summary: Rejects argument that s.13 makes receiver the sole assessee, holding owner remains liable.

holdings.text: The income though collected by the Receiver was the income of the appellant.

anchor.surface_text: The income though collected by the Receiver was the income of the appellant.

holdings.reasoning_summary: Income belongs to owner despite collection by receiver.

holdings.text: By s. 13, in addition to the owner, the Receiver is to be deemed to be an assessee. But the fact that the Receiver may... be deemed to be an assessee and liable to pay tax, does not absolve the appellant on whose behalf the income was received from the obligation to pay agricultural income-tax.

anchor.surface_text: By s. 13, in addition to the owner, the Receiver is to be deemed to be an assessee. But the fact that the Receiver may, because he held the property from which income was derived in the year of account, be deemed to be an assessee and liable to pay tax, does not absolve the appellant on whose behalf the income was received from the obligation to pay agricultural income-tax.

holdings.reasoning_summary: s.13 deems receiver assessee additionally, without relieving owner's liability under charging section.

holdings.text: Section 13 merely provides a machinery for recovery of tax, and is not a charging section.

anchor.surface_text: Section 13 merely provides a machinery for recovery of tax, and is not a charging section.

holdings.reasoning_summary: Distinguishes machinery provisions from charging provisions; machinery does not limit charge on owner.

holdings.text: When property is in the possession of the Receiver, common manager or administrator, the taxing authorities may, but are not bound to, treat such persons as assessees and recover tax. The taxing authorities may always proceed against the owner of the income and assess the tax against him.

anchor.surface_text: When property is in the possession of the Receiver, common manager or administrator, the taxing authorities may, but are not bound to, treat such persons as assessees and recover tax. The taxing authorities may always proceed against the owner of the income and assess the tax against him.

holdings.reasoning_summary: Tax authorities have discretion to assess either receiver or owner.

holdings.text: The definition in the connotation of person undoubtedly included a receiver, trustee, common manager, administrator or executor, and by such inclusion, it is open to the taxing authorities to assess tax against any such persons but on that account, the income in the hand of the owner is not exempt from liability to assessment of tax.

anchor.surface_text: The definition in the connotation of person undoubtedly included a receiver, trustee, common manager, administrator or executor, and by such inclusion, it is open to the taxing authorities to assess tax against any such persons but on that account, the income in the hand of the owner is not exempt from liability to assessment of tax.

holdings.reasoning_summary: Inclusion of receiver in 'person' definition enables assessment of receiver but does not exempt owner.

holdings.text: But this contention was never raised before the taxing authorities and no such question has been referred to this court.

anchor.surface_text: But this contention was never raised before the taxing authorities and no such question has been referred to this court.

holdings.reasoning_summary: Contention on income character not raised below or referred, hence not considered.
